text: Gustavo Arribas was the Director-General of the Federal Intelligence Agency of Argentina. He was appointed to the position in December 2015. ==Career== Prior to heading the Federal Intelligence Agency, Arribas was an agent and broker for professional soccer players. ==Corruption allegations== Arribas was accused by Brazilian police of receiving $850,000 through a money-laundering scheme. Arribas was also investigated for possibly accepting a bribe of $600,000 from Odebrecht in 2013. ==References== Category:Living people Category:Year of birth missing (living people) Category:Directors of intelligence agencies Category:People of Argentine intelligence agencies Category:People named in the Panama Papers
